Asymmetric encryption uses a single key for both encryption and decryption, while symmetric encryption uses a pair of keys.
There is no difference; they are interchangeable terms used in penetration testing.

Symmetric encryption is mainly used for performance testing, while asymmetric encryption is used for compatibility testing.
